page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The Little Orme had been inhabited for a very long time. Its name comes from the {Viking}word{orme}meaning{serpent. The Vikings raided the coast of Wales about 800 A.D.Long before that the { {Romans}mined{copper}on the Orme.Last year with his metal detector my Dad found some Roman coins and other things made of{bronze;}animals heads, brooches,knife handles and other things which we were told, were bucket handles.We took them to the National Museum in Cardiff.Two animal heads were very rare. The coins were dated 280-290 A.D. The other things were probably the same age.The bronzes had {bronze disease.}In the museum they showed us how to treat the disease and conserve the finds.We left them there. Maria(10)
